elements.title: Albert Tangora (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Albert Tangora (pictured), one of the most successful competitive typewriter speed typists, once had his hands insured for $100,000?

elements.title: Aujourd'hui (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the managing editor of Aujourd'hui was executed by firing squad in 1944?

elements.title: Michael Jurgens (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that football player Michael Jurgens never lost in 42 high school varsity games?

elements.title: Shiva (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the success of the British band Shiva was cut short by the death of its lead vocalist?

elements.title: Barron Trump (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Barron Trump signed for D.C. United Academy as a midfielder?

elements.title: The Sheep Eaters (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 1972 Finnish film The Sheep Eaters gathered more than a million viewers opposite the 1975 Ice Hockey World Championships match between Finland and the Soviet Union?

elements.title: gingras (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that according to second-century AD Greek rhetorician Athenaeus, the Phoenicians played a flute-like instrument called the gingras in their mourning rituals?

elements.title: 55 Broad Street (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that 55 Broad Street, a skyscraper in the Financial District of Manhattan, was called "an unlovable building in an unlivable neighborhood"?

elements.title: Sithu Pauk Hla (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that when Sithu Pauk Hla was appointed the governor of Yamethin, he was also given command of a 50-strong company of war elephants?
